Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2011 06:33PM Slainte wrote: Strictly speaking (and scientifically) metastatic means finding cancer cells away from the original tumour site. So although the pathology says metastatic, it only means it has spread to one lymph node. It is NOT the same as stage IV metastatic disease, which means cancer has spread out of the lymph system to other parts of body, most commonly bone, liver, lung and brain. Hope this isnhelpful Christine
Posts.Title: what is metastatic disease belleeast belleeast
